gurmukhi: iek rwm hI rwm khY muiK qy iek mwr hI mwr iehY aucrY ] iek jUiJ pry iek Gwie pry iek sXwm khw ieh BwNq rrY ]1191]
transliteration: Ik Raam Hiraam Kahai Moukh(i) Te Ik Maar Himaar Ihai Oucdarai|| Ik Joojh(i) Dare Ik Ghaae Dareik Syaam Kahaa Eh Bhaant Darai||1191||
translation: Someone is repeating the name of the Lord-god and someone is shouting loudly “Kill, Kill”; someone is dying and someone being wounded, is writhing.1191.

gurmukhi: mukIXw aulrY iek Awps mY gih kysin kysin eyk Ary hYN ] eyk cly rn qy Bij kY iek Awhv ko pg Awgy kry hYN ]
transliteration: Moukeedaa Ulrai Ik Aapas Mai Gadh Kesan(i) Kesan(i) Ekdare Hain|| Ek Chale Ran Te Bhaj(i) Kai Ik Aahav Ko Pag Aage Dare Hain||
translation: Someone is fighting with twisted fist and someone is fighting by catching the hair; someone is running away from the battlefield and someone is moving forward;

gurmukhi: eyk lry gih Pytin Pytin Pyt ktwrn soN doaU jUJ mrY hYN ] soaU lry kib sXwm rry Apuny kul kI joaU lwj Bry hYN ]1192]
transliteration: Ek Dare Gadh Phetan(i) Phet Kataaran Son Dooo Joojh Darai Hain|| Sooo Dare Kabi Syaam Dare Apoune Kul Kijooo Laaj Bhare Hain||1192||
translation: Someone is fighting with the girdles and someone is fighting by inflicting blows with his spear; the poet Shyam says that only those people are fighting, who think of their family-traditions.1192.

gurmukhi: AwTo hI BUp AXoDn mY sB lY pRiqnw hir aUpir Awey ] ju`D kro n fro hm qy kib sXwm khY ieh bYn sunwey ]
transliteration: Ootho Hibhoop Ayodhan Mai Sabh Lai Pratinaa Har(i) Oopar(i) Aae|| Juddh Daro Na Daro Ham Te Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bain Sounaae||
translation: All the eight kings fell upon Krishna alongwith their armies in the battlefield and said, “O Krishna ! fight with us fearlessly;”

gurmukhi: dY kY ksIsin eIsin cwNpin lY sr sRI hir Er clwey ] sXwm jU pwn srwsin lY sr so sr Awvq kwit igrwey ]1193]
transliteration: Dai Kai Kaseesan(i) Eesan(i) Chaanpan(i) Lai Sar Srihar(i) Or Chadhaae|| Syaam Joo Paan Saraasan(i) Lai Sar So Sar Aavat Kaattee Giraae||1193||
translation: Pulling their bows, they discharged their arrows towards Krishna and Krishna taking up his bow intercepted their arrows.1193.

gurmukhi: qau imil kY DujnI Air kI jdubIr chUM ids qy iris GyrXo ] Awpis mY imil kY Bt DIr hnXo blbIr iehY puin tyrXo ]
transliteration: Tau Mil(i) Kai Dhujniar(i) Jadoubeer Chahoon Dis Te Ris(i) Gheryo|| Oopas(i) Mai Mil(i) Kai Bhat Dheer Hanyo Balbeer Ihai Poun(i) Teryo||
translation: The enemy’s army, in great fury surrounded Krishna from all the four sides and said, “O warriors ! all of you may join together in order to kill Krishna;

gurmukhi: sRI Dn isMG blI Aclys kau Aaur nrySin XwhI inbyrXo ] ieau kih kY sr mwrq BXo gj puMj mno kir kyhr CyrXo ]1194]
transliteration: Sridhan Singh Baliachles Kau Aur Dareshan(i) Yaahiniberyo|| Io Kah(i) Kai Sar Maarat Bhayo Gad Pounj Mano Kar(i) Kehar Chheryo||1194||
translation: “It is he, who has killed Dhan Singh and Achlesh Singh and other kings,” saying this they surrounded Krishna like may elephants surrounding a lion.1194.

gurmukhi: Gyir lXo hir kO jb hI hir jU qb hI sB SsqR sMBwry ] kop AXoDn mY iPr kY irs swQ Gny Air bIr sMGwry ]
transliteration: Gher(i) Layo Har(i) Kau Job Hihar(i) Joo Tab Hisabh Shastra Sanbhdare|| Kop Ayodhan Mai Phir Kai Ris Saath Ghane Ar(i) Beer Sanhdare||
translation: When Krishna was besieged, he held up his weapons; in his fury, he killed many enemies in the battlefield; the heads of many were chopped,

gurmukhi: eykn ky isr kwit dey iek jIvq hI gih kys pCwry ] eyk lry kit BUim pry iek dyK fry mrgy ibn mwry ]1195]
transliteration: Ekan Ke Sir Kaattee Dae Ik Jeevat Higadh Kes Pachhdare|| Ek Dare Kattee Bhoom(i) Dare Ik Dekh Dare Marge Bin Mdare||1195||
translation: And many were knocked down by catching their hair; some of the warriors having been chopped fell on the earth and some of them seeing all this died without fighting.1195.
